comments.body:
This package has compiled code, so you're going to need a `build` section like in:

https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/blob/master/recipes/example/meta.yaml#L36-L39

Also since you're building a c-extension against numpy, please see:

https://conda-forge.org/docs/meta.html#building-against-numpy

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps --ignore-installed"

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}

comments.body: You can drop `pip`, `pytest` and `cython` from the `run` requirements, I believe.

I've raised an issue upstream related to the `license_file`:

https://github.com/brentp/fishers_exact_test/issues/21

Please put the above link as a comment in the `meta.yaml` as a reminder that this issue is pending and may be resolved in a future release.

diffHunk:

  # Upsream issue raised, https://github.com/brentp/fishers_exact_test/issues/21
  license_file: ''
  summary: Fast Fisher's Exact Test
